purpose: Complete Singles assessment adapted for couples context with AI-powered personalization layer. Core deterministic scoring preserved, AI enhancement focused on relationship improvement and partnership skills.

questions.text_A: I recharge around people and feel energized after shared time
questions.text_B: I recharge alone and feel drained after prolonged social time

questions.text_A: I prefer starting with group dates or social settings
questions.text_B: I prefer one-to-one time in quiet settings
I like social plans scheduled and limited

questions.text_A: I open up quickly with new people
questions.text_B: I take time before opening up

questions.text_A: I think out loud in conversations
questions.text_B: I think internally before speaking
Frequent check-ins feel intrusive
Large gatherings are tiring
I prefer fewer, deeper connections

questions.text_A: I am drawn by present chemistry and body language
questions.text_B: I am drawn by potential and long-term promise

questions.text_A: A great first date matters most
questions.text_B: Growth over time matters more than first impression

questions.text_A: I choose based on who they are now
questions.text_B: I choose based on who they can become
I value alignment to future goals
I prioritize future ambitions
A plan for tomorrow is essential
Future plans outweigh present compatibility
I assess trajectory

questions.text_A: Facts and patterns lead my choices
questions.text_B: Feelings and intuition lead my choices
I sit with how it feels
Emotional resonance convinces me
I prefer gentle, emotionally paced conversations

questions.text_A: I separate signal from noise logically
questions.text_B: I synthesize emotion and subtext first
Felt safety matters most
I calm conflict with empathy
I default to relational repair

questions.text_A: Routines and plans make me feel secure
questions.text_B: Flexibility and flow make me feel secure

questions.text_A: I like defined steps and timelines
questions.text_B: I like organic timing
We do best with room to adapt
I prefer deciding as we go
Shared freedom reduces friction
Milestones should emerge naturally

questions.text_A: I am comfortable committing to schedules
questions.text_B: I am comfortable following the moment
I want fluid roles

base_types.name: The Structured Connector
base_types.definition: Social, present-focused, evidence-led, and comfortable with plans and clear steps.

base_types.name: The Flexible Connector
base_types.definition: Social and present-focused, weighs facts, prefers a relaxed, adaptable pace.

base_types.name: The Steady-Heart Connector
base_types.definition: Outgoing and chemistry-first, guided by feelings, anchored by steady routines.

base_types.name: The Adaptive-Heart Connector
base_types.definition: Warm, expressive, chemistry-first; leads with emotion and prefers a natural rhythm.

base_types.name: The Strategic Connector
base_types.definition: People-oriented visionary; evaluates long-term potential logically with clear milestones.

base_types.name: The Fluid-Plan Connector
base_types.definition: Social and future-aware, rational in choices, keeps timelines adaptable.

base_types.name: The Compassion-First Connector
base_types.definition: Outgoing and hope-oriented, feels decisions deeply, appreciates predictable routines.

base_types.name: The Intuitive Connector
base_types.definition: Expressive and future-leaning, trusts emotional fit, prefers flexible unfolding.

base_types.name: The Structured Focuser
base_types.definition: Reserved and deliberate, evaluates current fit logically, prefers a steady cadence.

base_types.name: The Flexible Focuser
base_types.definition: Private and selective, weighs present realities with reason, keeps pace relaxed.

base_types.name: The Steady-Heart Focuser
base_types.definition: More private but emotionally tuned; values today's connection with steady routines.

base_types.name: The Adaptive-Heart Focuser
base_types.definition: Introspective and feeling-led, seeks authentic chemistry and a gentle, flexible pace.

base_types.name: The Strategic Focuser
base_types.definition: Quiet strategist; plans for long-term alignment using clear, rational criteria.

base_types.name: The Fluid-Plan Focuser
base_types.definition: Thoughtful and future-oriented, analyzes fit rationally with a fluid timeline.

base_types.name: The Compassion-First Focuser
base_types.definition: Private and ideal-driven, guided by values and feelings with reliable routines.

base_types.name: The Intuitive Focuser
base_types.definition: Reflective and hope-focused, led by emotion and meaning, favors a natural rhythm.

compute: Convert each answer to a signed value using value_mapping and the item's a_pole_letter
Sum signed values by strand → raw_s (integer, can be negative/zero/positive)

tie_break_when_raw_zero: if still tied: higher mean absolute item value within strand
if still tied: choose positive letter and set balanced=true

validity_flags.straight_line: true if ≥80% of all likert responses use the same intensity number (1..6) regardless of A/B side
validity_flags.inconsistency: true if within any strand ≥3 items with |value|≥2 oppose the decided letter's sign in that strand

prompt_templates.system_prompt: You are a relationship coach specializing in evidence-based relationship improvement for couples. Your goal is to help individuals understand their Singles assessment results and provide actionable steps for being a better partner in their current relationship. Focus on specific behaviors, communication skills, and relationship habits they can implement. Always be encouraging while being honest about areas for growth. Avoid generic advice - tailor everything to their specific type and how it shows up in relationship dynamics. Remember they are currently in a relationship, so focus on maintenance, growth, and deepening connection rather than attraction or dating.
prompt_templates.user_prompt_template:
Please analyze these Singles assessment results for someone currently in a relationship and provide a comprehensive relationship improvement plan:

Type: {type_code} - {type_name}
Base Definition: {base_definition}

Strand Details:
- Social Energy: {social_energy_pole} ({social_energy_index}%)
- Attraction Driver: {attraction_driver_pole} ({attraction_driver_index}%)
- Decision Filter: {decision_filter_pole} ({decision_filter_index}%)
- Relationship Pace: {relationship_pace_pole} ({relationship_pace_index}%)

Balanced Traits: {balanced_traits}
Validity Flags: {validity_flags}

Provide a personalized relationship improvement plan with:
1. Communication Approach (how they naturally communicate and how to optimize it)
2. Conflict Resolution Style (their approach to disagreements and how to improve)
3. Relationship Strengths (what they already bring to the partnership)
4. Growth Areas (specific areas to develop as a partner)
5. Partnership Affirmations (positive statements about their relationship contributions)
6. 30-60-90 Day Relationship Actions (concrete steps to strengthen their relationship)

Focus on what THEY can control and change about their own behavior in the relationship, not what their partner should do.

section_prompts.communication_approach: Based on their {type_code} profile, how do they naturally communicate in relationships? What are their communication strengths and how can they optimize their style for better connection with their partner?
section_prompts.conflict_resolution: How does this {type_code} type typically handle disagreements and conflict in relationships? What's their natural approach and how can they improve their conflict resolution skills?
section_prompts.relationship_strengths: What are 4 key strengths this {type_code} type brings to a romantic partnership? Focus on specific behaviors and qualities that benefit the relationship.
section_prompts.growth_areas: What are 4 areas where this {type_code} type could grow to be an even better partner? Consider relationship blind spots and development opportunities.
section_prompts.partnership_affirmations: Create 3 positive, personalized affirmations this person can use to reinforce their value as a partner and their commitment to relationship growth.
section_prompts.relationship_actions_30_60_90: Provide specific, actionable steps this {type_code} type can take in the next 30, 60, and 90 days to strengthen their current relationship. Each action should be concrete and measurable.

personalization_factors.strand_intensity: Use index percentages to determine how strongly to emphasize each dimension in relationship context
personalization_factors.balanced_traits: Address any balanced=true flags as areas of relationship flexibility rather than contradiction
personalization_factors.validity_concerns: Modify advice if straight_line or inconsistency flags are present
personalization_factors.type_combinations: Consider unique aspects of specific 4-letter combinations in relationship dynamics
personalization_factors.relationship_stage: Assume established relationship needing maintenance and growth, not early dating

sections.title: Your Communication Approach
sections.requirements: 5-8 sentences about their natural communication style in relationships

sections.title: Conflict Resolution Style
sections.requirements: 5-8 sentences about their approach to handling disagreements

sections.title: Relationship Strengths
sections.requirements: Exactly 4 items highlighting what they bring to the partnership

sections.title: Partnership Growth Areas
sections.requirements: Exactly 4 items for relationship development opportunities

requirements.day_30: 3 specific actions to strengthen relationship in first 30 days
requirements.day_60: 3 specific actions for days 31-60 relationship growth
requirements.day_90: 3 specific actions for days 61-90 relationship deepening

implementation_notes.relationship_context: This version assumes the individual is currently in a romantic relationship and seeks to improve their contribution to that partnership.
implementation_notes.focus_shift: From dating and attraction to relationship maintenance, communication, and partnership skills.
processing_flow: 1. User completes same 32 questions as singles version
2. Core assessment calculates identical deterministic results (type_code, strand scores, indices)
3. If AI enhancement enabled: pass results to couples-focused AI layer
4. AI generates relationship-focused content using couples prompt templates
5. Quality control validates AI response for relationship context
6. Final output combines deterministic data + relationship-focused AI insights
7. If AI fails at any step: use relationship-focused fallback content

data_separation.core_results: Identical to singles version - completely preserved
data_separation.ai_content: Clearly marked as AI-generated and relationship-focused

quality_assurance.relationship_focus_validation: Ensure all AI content is relevant to existing relationships, not dating
quality_assurance.partner_behavior_avoidance: Prevent advice about changing partner behavior - focus only on self-improvement
quality_assurance.fallback_triggers: AI timeout, invalid response, quality check failures, inappropriate content

fallback_sections: array of section names that used fallback
